image.altText: Paramedics with stretcher at night outside of church, and close up picture of bishop

props.synopsis: At least two police officers have been injured as large crowds clashed with authorities following the stabbing of a bishop during a live-streamed church service in Sydney's south-west last night.

title.children: Sydney church stabbing being investigated as 'terrorist act', authorities say

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Why was this a terrorist attack but not the one at Bondi Junction?
National Security Committee meeting in Canberra

image.altText: Queensland Police have increased their presence in shopping centres in the wake of the Bondi Junction attack.

props.synopsis: Queensland Police says it is confident the response to previous interactions with the Bondi Junction attacker were "appropriate".

title.children: Bondi Junction attacker's interactions with Queensland Police 'forensically' examined amid debate over stop-and-search laws

image.altText: NOLs_RCChurchStabbing_1604

props.synopsis: Senior cabinet leaders and government agencies are meeting to discuss the incident in Wakeley last night.

title.children: PM calls security meeting in Canberra as leaders condemn Sydney church attack

image.altText: Illustration of Lisa Wilkins, Bruce Lehrmann and Brittany Higgins

props.synopsis: The case's unexpected detours and collateral damage were acknowledged by Justice Michael Lee, in what he described as "an omnishambles", writes Jamie McKinnell.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's defamation judgment is a scathing assessment of key players

image.altText: Bruce walks along wearing a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: Yesterday, Justice Michael Lee ruled that Bruce Lehrmann probably raped Brittany Higgins that fateful night in March 2019, after the pair arrived at Parliament House in the small hours. But an expert says it's unlikely a second criminal trial will go ahead.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann unlikely to face second criminal trial for rape following defamation case ruling, experts say

image.altText: A man wearing a Woolworths polo shirt with the name tag 'Brad' stands in a supermarket.

props.synopsis: Woolworths and Coles will be grilled over higher prices and rising profits during the cost-of-living crisis at a Senate inquiry in Canberra today, while the Australian share market has fallen sharply. Follow live.

title.children: 'Not interested in your spin': Senator accuses Woolworths CEO Banducci of dodging questions, ASX falls sharply

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: The hearing has resumed after a brief suspension
ASX  falls sharply as Middle East tensions weigh on investors
Senate suspended after threatening to hold Banducci in contempt

image.altText: A collage including photos of the Bondi Junction attacker and a young man in the bush, and a tweet.

props.synopsis: For 14 hours over the weekend, Sydney university student Ben Cohen was one of the most reviled men on the internet, falsely accused of the Bondi Junction stabbings. Here's how the lie spread around the world.

title.children: Ben was falsely accused of stabbing six people to death. Here's how this falsehood spread

image.altText: A crowd of out-of-focus people walk in front of a large in-focus Coles supermarket sign.

props.synopsis: For years, big retailers have competed at the check-out while tightening the screws on those who stock their shelves and boosting their profits. It's a far cry from the price-fixing tactics of Visy and Richard Pratt — but it seems the jig is up.

title.children: Why our supermarkets and major retailers changed tack on their price gouging tactics

image.altText: Donald Trump sits at a bench and looks at the camera. He is frowning.

props.synopsis: For the next six weeks or so a courtroom on the 15th floor of the New York County Supreme Court will be the setting for a trial that made history before it even started. And once again, Donald Trump is at the centre of unprecedented events.

title.children: Trump's first criminal trial is finally starting. This is what happened in court on day one

image.altText: Blue City Cat ferry called Nar-Dha on Brisbane river, with the South East Freeway and South Bank in view.

props.synopsis: The new system will allow commuters to touch on and off their services with a debit card, credit card or smart device. It's already in use on South-East Queensland trains and trams.

title.children: Smart ticketing kicks off on Brisbane ferries as an alternative payment option to go cards

image.altText: A world globe in front of a underwater world of reefs and corals with a graph indicating sea surface temperature rising

props.synopsis: After a year of record-breaking heat, a devastating story has been playing out in the world's oceans. Scientists working along the most breathtaking reefs show what led to climate agency NOAA calling a global bleaching event for only the fourth time in history.

title.children: 'Moved to tears': The hottest year on record unleashes a mass coral bleaching tragedy

image.altText: A dog sleeping with a magpie on it's back

props.synopsis: The Insta-famous magpie that forged a friendship with a Staffordshire terrier pup is returned to the family that raised it without the required permits.

title.children: 'Wiggly bottoms' and cries of happiness as Molly the magpie is reunited with Gold Coast family and canine pal

image.altText: A grey drone flies through the air.

props.synopsis: A drone with beefed up surveillance that can fly higher, further and faster than previous models is deployed to help protect the reef from outlaw anglers.

title.children: New 'virtually undetectable' drone set to track down illegal fishers raiding the Great Barrier Reef

image.altText: Mia and Eliza are standing with arms around each other, grafitti in background with posters glued to the wall

props.synopsis: After enduring countless sexist insults, 15-year-old Mia Murphy and her friend decided to call out the haters in a creative way, in Melbourne's Hosier Lane.

title.children: When Mia's school failed to punish her bullies, she took matters into her own hands

image.altText: A woman wheeling a trolley down an aisle in a Woolworths store. The trolley has a few items in it.

props.synopsis: Woolworths and Coles will be interrogated over their rising prices, growing profits and market power by a dedicated Senate committee examining supermarket prices later today. Here's what to expect from their appearances.

title.children: Woolworths and Coles will be asked to explain their profits and higher prices today. Here's what to expect

image.altText: David Pocock holding a press conference at Parliament House

props.synopsis: Since his elevation to the Senate in May 2022, David Pocock has been striking terror into the heart of the establishment, on a mission to hold Canberra to account. Now, he has the Department of Defence in his sights.

title.children: David Pocock is on an accountability mission — and the senator expects answers

image.altText: Nathan Murphy

props.synopsis: Collingwood announces defender Nathan Murphy has retired from the AFL after getting advice from the medical concussion panel.

title.children: Magpies defender Murphy retires from the AFL after ongoing concussion concerns

image.altText: Two young girls smile arm-in-arm, one has a surfboard under her arm

props.synopsis: Communities are key to fighting our loneliness epidemic, but finding your people isn't always as easy as it sounds. Byron Bay and its surroundings are home to a collection of eccentric communities, whose stories and friendships hold lessons for the rest of the country.

title.children: Influencers, 'radical hippies' and those sleeping rough — lessons on fighting loneliness from Byron Bay's communities

image.altText: nsw ambulances and police outside the westfield shopping centre at bondi junction after a mass stabbing event

props.synopsis: After the Bondi Junction knife attack on the weekend, there's debate about whether security guards have enough protection and powers to keep themselves, and the public, safe.

title.children: 'They don't stand a chance': After the Bondi Junction attack, do security guards need more powers?

image.altText: Youth matter

props.synopsis: The now-expired Alice Springs youth curfew has triggered mixed reactions, lauded as a "circuit-breaker" by some and a "punitive", "knee-jerk" response by others. Here's a look back at what we learned.

title.children: The youth curfew in Alice Springs has ended. So what did we learn?

image.altText: A broken part from a drone on top of sand with water canisters in the background

props.synopsis: Iran's attack on Israel could have massive implications for the Middle East but experts say the actions of other regional powers could be more important.

title.children: 'Iran could do much more': Why the drone attack on Israel sends an important message

image.altText: A city late at night with three streaks of light going up in the air.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of drones and missiles were launched towards Israel in an Iranian attack analysts say was unlike anything the world had seen. This is how Israel was able to thwart the five-hour onslaught.

title.children: How Israel managed to intercept '99 per cent' of Iran's drone and missile onslaught

image.altText: A fighter jet at a runway

props.synopsis: Israel's military chief vows that his country will respond to the Iranian attack that saw hundreds of drones and missiles fired at its territory.

title.children: Israel says it will respond to Iran's unprecedented aerial attack, as Israel's allies call for restraint

image.altText: Special operations soldier

props.synopsis: A "small amount" of uranium ore and a Geiger counter are secured and contained after being discovered in a solders' bedroom at Holsworthy Barracks.

title.children: 'Potentially hazardous' uranium found in soldier's room at Sydney's Holsworthy Barracks

image.altText: A woman dabbing her eyes with a tissue with people sitting on either side of her

props.synopsis: Hannah Gutierrez is jailed for involuntary manslaughter after mistakenly loading a live round into a revolver Alec Baldwin was using which killed Halyna Hutchins and injured director Joel Souza.

title.children: Rust armourer Hannah Gutierrez sentenced to 18 months in prison

image.altText: Kylie Minogue and Rafael Bonachela are smiling brightly with their arms around one another. They both have blue make-up on.

props.synopsis: The artistic director of Sydney Dance Company has come a long way from his hometown in Spain to the top of contemporary dance in Australia.

title.children: 'I always lived off dancing': How Rafael Bonachela went from small-town Spain to working with Kylie

image.altText: A horse on a jetty pulling a tram with an island and sea in the background

props.synopsis: One of the beloved Clydesdale horses of South Australia's tram to Granite Island – the last horse-drawn tram in Australia – has died after being infected with Ross River virus, the operator says.

title.children: Beloved Victor Harbor horse dies after falling ill with Ross River virus, operator says

image.altText: A man with a long grey beard and wearing a hat.

props.synopsis: The parents of Joel Cauchi describe their son as tormented after he killed six people and wounded several others at Bondi Junction on the weekend.

title.children: 'I'm sorry he's done this to the nation': Andrew Cauchi breaks down speaking about killer son

image.altText: tall man walking through shop with backpack

props.synopsis: The man's identity remains a mystery after months of work searching missing persons registers and public appeals. Now police are launching a global appeal to return the man's body to his family.

title.children: This man's body was found floating in Maroochy River. Police still don't know who he is

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Lawrence Wong pose for photos shaking hands.

props.synopsis: In the more than 58 years since Singapore was granted its independence, Australia has seen 17 prime ministers, while the island nation has had just three. So, what can we expect from Lawrence Wong when the deputy leader takes over from Lee Hsien Loong next month?

title.children: 'A new generation of leadership': Singapore chooses its fourth PM in six decades — on a $2.5m salary

image.altText: A man dressed as popeye sits in a hollowed out 400 kilo pumpkin waving as he paddles in a river

props.synopsis: A fan of shenanigans and the unnecessary, the former commodore of the Tumut Canoe Club donned a captain's hat and pipe to paddle the biggest pumpkin grown in Australia this year down a river, Popeye style.

title.children: Man turns mammoth 400kg prize-winning pumpkin into a canoe, paddles it down river
